headline: Democrat candidates running hard  AWAY from Biden
author: WND News Services
sentences: According to February polling by the University of Texas, 43% of Texans disapprove strongly? of Biden while just 15% approve strongly.? A closer look at a key demographic in the cross tabs could also be concerning: 42% of Hispanic voters give the president a passing grade while 38% disapprove, a difference within the poll's margin of error.

That is according to Chuck Rocha, a leading Democratic strategist and former adviser to Sen. Bernie Sanders, who is also urging his clients to lean into White House accomplishments, even if candidates talk about Democratic accomplishments generally rather than Biden's achievements specifically.

As Democrats seek to defend their razor-slim congressional majorities, a number of vulnerable incumbents are keeping the president at arm's length in reliably Republican red Texas ahead of the state's March 1 primary, an awkward trend that is likely to continue as the midterm elections loom.
